  • mocharts.plot.plots.lineplot

mocharts.plot.plots.lineplot#

mocharts.plot.plots.lineplot(x: list | ndarray, y: list | ndarray, label: list | ndarray = None, color: str | list = None, fill_area: bool = False, symbol: str = 'none', symbol_size: int = 4, line_type: str = 'solid', same_x: bool = False, sorted_axis: bool = False, step: str = None)#

Draw a line plot

Parameters:

  • x (numpy.ndarray, List) – Data element 1.

  • y (numpy.ndarray, List) – Data element 2.

  • label (numpy.ndarray, List, str, Optional) – The label for the data class. Default is None.

  • color (str, List, Optional) – The color for the line. If color is a list, it specifies the color for each group. Default is None.

  • fill_area (bool, Optional) – Whether to fill the area under the curve. Default is False.

  • symbol (str, Optional) – Choose the symbol for the points. Options include ‘emptyCircle’, ‘circle’, ‘rect’, ‘roundRect’, ‘triangle’, ‘diamond’, ‘pin’, ‘arrow’, ‘none’. Default is ‘none’.

  • symbol_size (int, Optional) – The symbol size. Default is 4.

  • line_type (str, Optional) – Choose the line style. Options are ‘solid’, ‘dashed’, and ‘dotted’. Default is ‘solid’.

  • same_x (bool, Optional) – Whether to use the same x-axis for all labels. Only works when label is not None. Default is False.

  • sorted_axis (bool, Optional) – Whether to sort the values based on the axis. Default is None.

  • step (str, Optional) – Whether to show the plot as a step line. Default is None, which means no step line. Options include ‘start’, ‘middle’ and ‘end’.

Returns:

The figure object.

Return type:

Figure
